bug.short_desc: Virtual: Create tree widget with data binding

long_desc.thetext:
Creating a list, selectbox and combobox in the virtual area should help us gather much experience needed to develop a virtual tree widget based on the hopefully well tested infrastructure the time we have these other three widgets ready.
I mark the bug for target milestone 1.2 but its optional for the release. Thats why its only P4 for 1.2
Moving all virtual widget bugs/tasks to Chris.
We start to implement a first version form the virtual tree with a basic set of features for the current 1.4 release. But the full implementation will be ready in a later release.

Hi,
just a couple of suggestions:
1. use some defaults to childProperty ("children") and labelPath ("label")
2. change childProperty to childrenPath. It is more coherent to the rest (labelPath, iconPath).
VirtualTree:852: __getParen : function(item) is missing a "t" in the name.

(In reply to comment #4) > 1. use some defaults to childProperty ("children") and labelPath ("label") We don't have that for the old controllers so would not add that for the new stuff.
> 2. change childProperty to childrenPath. It is more coherent to the rest > (labelPath, iconPath). It depends if its the same functionality. If we can specify a path, then we should name it the same. If not, which is the current state as far as I know, a different name is suitable.

(In reply to comment #7) > (In reply to comment #6) > > It depends if its the same functionality. If we can specify a path, then we > > should name it the same. If not, which is the current state as far as I know, a > > different name is suitable. > > What is the current state? I used it and as far I can tell, it does exactly as > labelPath does but for the children path: > > From VirtualTree.js: > /** > * The name of the property, where the children are stored in the model. > * Instead of the {@link #labelPath} must the child property a direct > * property form the model instance. > */ > ... > var children = node.get(this.getChildProperty());
Well, the documentation shows that you can not use chaining (e.g. "prop1.prop2[0].prop3") which makes the child a simple property and not a chain so I would not change the name.
